      • insertNewLineIndentMarker

        public static TextRange insertNewLineIndentMarker(PsiFile file,
                                                  Document document,
                                                  int offset)
        Formatter trims line that contains white spaces symbols only, however, there is a possible case that we want to preserve them for particular line (e.g. for live template that defines line with whitespaces that contains $END$ marker: templateText $END$).

        Current approach is to do the following: 

         
          
   
        1. Insert dummy text at the end of the blank line which white space symbols should be preserved;
          2. 
   
        2. Perform formatting;
          3. 
   
        3. Remove dummy text;
          4.

        This method inserts that dummy comment (fallback to identifier xxx, see createDummy(PsiFile)) if necessary.

        Note: it's expected that the whole white space region that contains given offset is processed in a way that all range markers registered for the given offset are expanded to the whole white space region. E.g. there is a possible case that particular range marker serves for defining formatting range, hence, its start/end offsets are updated correspondingly after current method call and whole white space region is reformatted.

        Parameters:
        file - target PSI file
        document - target document
        offset - offset that defines end boundary of the target line text fragment (start boundary is the first line's symbol)
        Returns:
        text range that points to the newly inserted dummy text if any; null otherwise
        Throws:
        IncorrectOperationException - if given file is read-only

      • findWhiteSpaceNode

        public static PsiElement findWhiteSpaceNode(PsiFile file,
                                            int offset)
        Allows to check if given offset points to white space element within the given PSI file and return that white space element in the case of positive answer.
        Parameters:
        file - target file
        offset - offset that might point to white space element within the given PSI file
        Returns:
        target white space element for the given offset within the given file (if any); null otherwise

      • isSequentialProcessingAllowed

        public boolean isSequentialProcessingAllowed()
        Description copied from class: CodeStyleManager
        Formatting may be executed sequentially, i.e. the whole (re)formatting task is split into a number of smaller sub-tasks that are executed sequentially. That is done primarily for ability to show progress dialog during formatting (formatting is always performed from EDT, hence, the GUI freezes if we perform formatting as a single big iteration).

        However, there are situation when we don't want to use such an approach - for example, the IDE sometimes inserts dummy text into file in order to calculate formatting-specific data and removes it after that. We don't want to allow Swing events dispatching during that in order to not show that dummy text to the end-user.

        It's possible to configure that (implementation details are insignificant here) and current method serves as a read-only facade for obtaining information if 'sequential' processing is allowed at the moment.

        Specified by:
        isSequentialProcessingAllowed in class CodeStyleManager
        Returns:
        true if 'sequential' formatting is allowed now; false otherwise

      • setSequentialProcessingAllowed

        public static void setSequentialProcessingAllowed(boolean allowed)
        Allows to define if sequential processing should be allowed.

        Current approach is not allow to stop sequential processing for more than predefine amount of time (couple of seconds). That means that call to this method with 'true' argument is not mandatory for successful processing even if this method is called with 'false' argument before.

        Parameters:
        allowed - flag that defines if sequential processing should be allowed

      • performActionWithFormatterDisabled

        public void performActionWithFormatterDisabled(java.lang.Runnable r)
        Description copied from class: CodeStyleManager
        Disables automatic formatting of modified PSI elements, runs the specified operation and re-enables the formatting. Can be used to improve performance of PSI write operations.
        Specified by:
        performActionWithFormatterDisabled in class CodeStyleManager
        Parameters:
        r - the operation to run.

      • scheduleIndentAdjustment

        public void scheduleIndentAdjustment(Document document,
                                     int offset)
        Description copied from class: CodeStyleManager
        Performs a delayed indent adjustment for large documents bigger than FormatterBasedIndentAdjuster.MAX_SYNCHRONOUS_ADJUSTMENT_DOC_SIZE by scheduling it to a time when the document is committed. Uses formatter to calculate the new indent on a background thread. Only the actual change is done on EDT: the old indent is replaced with a new indent string directly in the document. Doesn't commit the document, thus a subsequent PsiDocumentManager.commitDocument(Document) may be required.

        Note: visually it may lead to a text jump which becomes more obvious, more time it takes to calculate the new indent using a formatting model. A better way to handle large documents is to implement LineIndentProvider returning a non-null value when possible.

        Overrides:
        scheduleIndentAdjustment in class CodeStyleManager
        Parameters:
        document - The document to be modified.
        offset - The offset in the line whose indent is to be adjusted.
